template.name: Expressed Sequence Tag (EST)
template.description: For submission of Sanger-sequenced Expressed Sequence Tags (ESTs). ESTs are short transcripts ~500-800bp long usually of low quality as they are the result of only single pass reads. No feature annotation is recorded on ESTs.
template.comment: For EST sequences, EMBL-bank requires additional source information, other than the organism name. Please provide as much detail as possible by selecting at least one relevant field below (e.g., tissue type, development stage)

token.name: COMMENTS
token.description: Please provide a brief experimental overview including library construction details. This will appear in a CC line.

token.name: ORGANISM
token.description: Formal taxonomic name of organism.
token.tip: Mus musculus, Drosophila melanogaster, Homo sapiens

token.name: STRAIN
token.description: Name or identifier for strain, typically a collection prefix followed by a number.

token.name: HAPLOTYPE
token.description: The haplotype designation to which these sequence belongs.

token.name: CLONE
token.description: Identifier given to each clone in a sequenced library.

token.name: CLONELIB
token.description: Name given to the clone library that has been sequenced.

token.name: ISOLATE
token.description: Name given to the environmental isolate that has been sequenced.

token.name: COUNTRY
token.description: Political name of country or ocean in which sequenced sample or isolate was collected.

token.name: AREA
token.description: Political name of the area of country or ocean in which sequenced sample or isolate was collected. Must have Country selected.

token.name: LOCALITY
token.description: More geographic-specific location where sequenced material was sourced. Must have Country AND Geographic area selected.

token.name: LATLON
token.description: Geographical coordinates of the location where the specimen was collected, in decimal degrees (to 2 places).

token.name: ISOSOURCE
token.description: Physical geography of sampling/isolation site.

token.name: BREED
token.description: The recognised breed name of the organism, please use cultivar or variety for plants/fungi.
token.tip: Bull terrier, Friesian Holstein, Large white

token.name: SEX
token.description: sex of the organism from which the sequence was obtained; sex is used for eukaryotic organisms that undergo meiosis and have sexually dimorphic gametes.

token.name: DEVSTAGE
token.description: Developmental stage of the organism, either a named stage, or a measurement of time.
token.tip: fourth instar larva, 3 day old, blastula

token.name: CELLTYPE
token.description: Cell type (in a multicellular organism) from which sequence was generated.

token.name: TISSUETYPE
token.description: Tissue type from which sequence was generated.

token.name: COLDATE
token.description: Date of collection of the original sample/organism.

token.name: COLBY
token.description: Collector(s) of the sample.

token.name: VARIETY
token.description: variety (= varietas, a formal Linnaean rank) of organism from which sequence was derived. Use the cultivar qualifier for cultivated plant varieties, i.e., products of artificial selection.

token.name: ECOTYPE
token.description: A population within a given species displaying genetically based, phenotypic traits that reflect adaptation to a local habitat.

token.name: CULTIVAR
token.description: cultivar (cultivated variety) of plant from which sequence was obtained, and is applied solely to products of artificial selection; use the variety qualifier for natural, named plant and fungal varieties.

token.name: HOST
token.description: The natural host of the organism from which the sequenced material was taken.

token.name: SEQUENCE
token.description: Nucleotide sequence that has been generated.

token.name: CULTCOLL
token.description: Reference to a live microbial or fungal culture or cell line in a curated culture collection see http://www.ebi.ac.uk/ena/WebFeat/qualifiers/culture_collection.html

token.name: SPECVOUCH
token.description: Reference to a physical specimen from a curated or lab herbarium, museum or tissue collection.

token.name: BIOMAT
token.description: Reference to a living specimen or direct DNA sample from zoos, aquaria, stock centres, seed banks, germplasm repositories and DNA banks. Use where Culture Collection or Specimen Voucher are not appropriate.
token.tip: freetext like AB12345; structured like CGC:CB3912

token.name: PFNAME1
token.description: Name of the forward direction PCR primer.

token.name: PRNAME1
token.description: Name of the reverse direction PCR primer.

token.name: PFSEQ1
token.description: Sequences should be given in the IUPAC degenerate-base alphabet, except for the modified bases; those must be enclosed within angle brackets.

token.name: PRSEQ1
token.description: Sequences should be given in the IUPAC degenerate-base alphabet, except for the modified bases; those must be enclosed within angle brackets.

token.name: PFNAME2
token.description: Name of the 2nd forward direction PCR primer.

token.name: PRNAME2
token.description: Name of the 2nd reverse direction PCR primer.

token.name: PFSEQ2
token.description: Sequences should be given in the IUPAC degenerate-base alphabet, except for the modified bases; those must be enclosed within angle brackets.

token.name: PRSEQ2
token.description: Sequences should be given in the IUPAC degenerate-base alphabet, except for the modified bases; those must be enclosed within angle brackets.

token_group.name: Basic Details
token_group.description: Organism from which the sequenced material was taken.

token_group.name: Plant/Fungal specific
token_group.description: Qualifiers specifically for samples of plants or fungi.

token_group.name: Repository Data
token_group.description: References to biorepositories (culture collections, specimen vouchers and biomaterials.)

token_group.name: Experimental Details
token_group.description: Details of the experiment and library.

token_group.name: PCR Primers
token_group.description: Details of the PCR primers used.

template.template_string: ID XXX; SV XXX; linear; mRNA; EST; XXX; {SEQUENCE_LENGTH} BP. XX ST * {STATUS} XX AC ; XX DE {ORGANISM} EST{{BREED_SCT}}, breed {BREED}{{/BREED_SCT}}{{CULT_SCT}}, cultivar {CULTIVAR}{{/CULT_SCT}}{{HAPLO_SCT}}, haplotype {HAPLOTYPE}{{/HAPLO_SCT}}{{STRAIN_SCT}}, strain {STRAIN}{{/STRAIN_SCT}}{{SPECVOUCH_SCT}}, specimen voucher {SPECVOUCH}{{/SPECVOUCH_SCT}}{{ISOLATE_SCT}}, isolate {ISOLATE}{{/ISOLATE_SCT}}{{CLONE_SCT}}, clone {CLONE}{{/CLONE_SCT}} XX KW EST; expressed sequence tag. XX OS OC . XX {CITATIONS} {COMMENTS} XX FH Key Location/Qualifiers FH FT source 1..{SEQUENCE_LENGTH} FT /organism="{ORGANISM}" FT /mol_type="mRNA" FT /strain="{STRAIN}" FT /clone="{CLONE}" FT /clone_lib="{CLONELIB}" FT /isolate="{ISOLATE}" FT /country="{COUNTRY}{{AREA_SCT}}:{AREA}{{LOCALITY_SCT}}, {LOCALITY}{{/LOCALITY_SCT}}{{/AREA_SCT}}" FT /lat_lon="{LATLON}" FT /note="breed:{BREED}" FT /haplotype="{HAPLOTYPE}" FT /sex="{SEX}" FT /isolation_source="{ISOSOURCE}" FT /collection_date="{COLDATE}" FT /collected_by="{COLBY}" FT /culture_collection="{CULTCOLL}" FT /specimen_voucher="{SPECVOUCH}" FT /bio_material="{BIOMAT}" FT /cultivar="{CULTIVAR}" FT /variety="{VARIETY}" FT /ecotype="{ECOTYPE}" FT /host="{HOST}" FT /dev_stage="{DEVSTAGE}" FT /cell_type="{CELLTYPE}" FT /tissue_type="{TISSUETYPE}" FT /PCR_primers="{{PFNAME1_SCT}}fwd_name: {PFNAME1}, {{/PFNAME1_SCT}}fwd_seq: {PFSEQ1}, {{PF2_SCT}}{{PFNAME2_SCT}}fwd_name: {PFNAME2}, {{/PFNAME2_SCT}}{{PFSEQ2_SCT}}fwd_seq: {PFSEQ2}, {{/PFSEQ2_SCT}}{{/PF2_SCT}}{{PRNAME1_SCT}}rev_name: {PRNAME1}, {{/PRNAME1_SCT}}rev_seq: {PRSEQ1}{{PR2_SCT}}{{PRNAME2_SCT}}, rev_name: {PRNAME2}{{/PRNAME2_SCT}}{{PRSEQ2_SCT}}, rev_seq: {PRSEQ2}{{/PRSEQ2_SCT}}{{/PR2_SCT}}" XX {SEQUENCE}//
template.example_string:
ESTs are single pass reads generated from transcribed DNA (cDNA) and represent a portion of an expressed transcript. The only quality restriction placed on EST submissions is the removal of terminal uncalled (n) bases.

The EST sequence record contains only a source feature with the following relevant information:
organism name, unique sequence identifier (e.g. clone or isolate name), tissue type, developmental stage, organism modifiers (e.g.strain) and clone (or tissue) library name.
